oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Deworming Practices and Avermectin Resistance in Beef Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Scharko, P. B.
Myers, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cattle
parasites
avermectin products
worms
deworming
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Survey results indicate that Kentucky beef producers deworm their cattle at least one each year. It is important to reduce the parasite load in young calves. Avermectin products eliminated ostertagia adult worms but not did not completely eliminate cooperia worms in calves at weaning time.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2007
